alert.note: Alert for Eagle; Garfield; Pitkin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 19 at 1:05PM MST until January 19 at 7:00PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... An Ice Jam Break in... The Roaring Fork River Basin from the town of Basalt through Carbondale, in southeast Garfield County. * Until 700 PM MST. * At 105 PM MST, stream gage reports a rapid drop in water level along the Roaring Fork River near Basalt, CO. The potential for an ice jam release on the Roaring Fork River is imminent which would result in a wave of water, ice and debris downstream. HAZARD...Flash flooding from an ice jam release. SOURCE...Gage reported. IMPACT...Rapid rise in water level and flow downstream Snowmass Canyon. * The nearest downstream town is Basalt, CO. This includes the following streams and drainages... Roaring Fork River A wave of water, ice and debris moving down the Roaring Fork River from Basalt to Carbondale is imminent. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Anglers, move away from the river and seek higher ground.
